Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Copulate \Cop"u*late\, a. [L. copulatus, p. p. of copulare to couple, fr. copula. See {Copula}.] 1. Joined; associated; coupled. [Obs.] --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
2. (Gram.) Joining subject and predicate; copulative. --F. A. March. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Copulate \Cop"u*late\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Copulated}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Copulating}.] To unite in sexual intercourse; to come together in the act of generation. [1913 Webster]
copulate v : make love; "Birds mate in the Spring" [syn: {mate}, {pair}, {couple}]
